content.description: To the left of The Pocket Problem.

Start where Pinnacle Rock meets Plaque rock and traverse around the arete and all the way to the Off-Width Crack.  Mainly balancy moves, but the primary challenge is just the length of the traverse (~45').You can just as easily go left to right as well.
content.protection: Soft landings beneath a traverse where you don't get very high.  A spotter is merely a luxury.

content.description: Located just to the right of the Offwidth Crack, this challenging face climb requires balance and either a long reach or some burly slapping.  The crux is about 10 feet off the ground on the slightly overhanging section.  Once the face gets less steep the climbing gets really easy.
content.protection: Set up a tope rope from the pole atop Pinnicle Rock.  About a 30 foot sling will do the trick.

content.description:
Climb just left of the warmup jug and hueco route, and about 5 feet to the right of the huge crack.

Climb up over the bulge using all the finger pockets, crimps and jugs to easier climbing on the less than vertical top section.

Watch your feet on the bottom of the route unless you like doing pullups.
content.protection: Set up a top rope using a long sling (20') on the large pole set into the top of the rock.

content.description: An off-width crack that would pose severe difficulty were it not at such a kind angle.I loved the climb but i don't mind getting dirty.  If you do mind getting dirty it may not be worth it.
content.protection: Honestly, I don't know.  I solo-ed it and was more concentrated on the climb than how to protect it.  There is a pretty straightforward walk-off back and left.

content.description: The holds aren't quite as big nor as frequent as the Neighbor to the left, Bucket Prow.  But still a pretty straight-forward pocketed face climb.
content.protection: There is a old (but sturdy!)metal pole sticking out of the top of the Pinnicle, from which, you can set up a top rope for most of the routes on the rock.  Bring a long sling because the top is not steep at all.

content.description: Combine Remillard Travese and Plaque Traverse (in either direction).
content.protection: Pads if you really want but you donâ€™t get too high off the ground

content.description:
Climb straight up on the face to the left of the crack. The crack is off.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LqxYkL6UomE&list=PL5V8eV-Ye0sSEVwYNj3ibvjI44gO59ZgN&index=4
content.location: To the left of the ofwidth crack.

content.description:
The left-most climb that faces the road on

Pinnacle Rock

. Lots of large holds on a steep broad arete. Much more exciting beginner climb than a slab.
content.protection: There is a old (but sturdy!) metal pole sticking out of the top of the Pinnacle, from which, you can set up a top rope for most of the routes on the rock. Bring a long sling because the top is not steep at all.

content.description: Right-most climb on the Pinnicle.The dusty, balancy boulding problem beginning is a stark contrast to the mossy, reachy moves that await over the roof.  Great climb were it not for the dirtiness.
content.protection: There is a old (but sturdy!)metal pole sticking out of the top of the Pinnicle, from which, you can set up a top rope for most of the routes on the rock.  Bring a long sling because the top is not steep at all.
